Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [entering office] Hey, have they left for the big meeting yet? I've got Michael's lucky tie.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No. They're in the conference room.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wait, are those Michael's Levis?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah, who dry-cleans jeans?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael and his jeans. He gets in them, and I'm not exactly sure what happens. But I can tell you, he loves the way he looks in those jeans. I know that's why he started casual Fridays.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to Ryan] I'll take those. Thanks. [throws jeans under her desk]

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: This is a projection of the county's needs...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow, graphs and charts, somebody's really been doing their homework. Looks like USA Today.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Thirteen schools, uh, two hospitals...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So this possible client they're talking about, actually a big deal. It's Lackawanna County. Our whole county. And if we get this, they may not have to downsize our branch. And I could work here for years. And years. [groan] Years.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: So when we get to the Radisson, I'd like to, um-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I changed it. To Chili's.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Excuse me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Radisson just gives out this vibe, "Oh, I'm doing business at the Radisson". It's kind of snooty. So.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You had no right to do that, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here's the thing. Chili's is the new golf course. It's where business happens. Small Businessman Magazine.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: It said that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It will. I sent it in. Letter to the editor.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Alright. But you will let me run this meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh huh, uh huh. [under his breath] Power trip.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: She had done a background check on me, she had it printed out.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yeah. And she was asking me about stuff, line by line, while we were having dinner.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: That is unbelievable.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What is going on?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We are doing worst first dates.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh my God, I win! Ok, it was a minor league hockey game. He brought his brother, and when I went to the bathroom, the game ended and they forgot about me.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Ok, that's a joke.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, they had to come back for me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wait, when was this?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Umm... it was not that long ago.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Wait, not Roy. Say it's not your fiance. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I always knew Pam has refused to go to sports games with Roy, but I never knew why. Interesting.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, let's do this thing. [to Pam] Wish us luck.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good luck, Michael. Good luck, Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [under his breath] Kiss ass. Ok, probably going to go late tonight. Burning the midnight tequila. So, I think you could all just take off now.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael, shouldn't take more than an hour.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Do you always shut down the entire office when you leave for an hour?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no. That would not be efficient. Actually, they just don't get very much work done when I'm not here. [Jan stares at Michael] That's not true. I know how to delegate, and they do more work done when I'm not here. Not more. The same amount of work is done, whether I am here or not. [another Jan stare] Hey, everybody, listen up. This is what we're gonna do. You sit tight, until I return. Sound good? Doesn't matter, it's an order. Follow it blindly, mwahahaha, ok? Alright, ciao. [to Oscar] Adios!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: So which way is Chili's?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, I'll drive.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh, no, that's alright. I wanna leave straight from there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's just a couple blocks away, so... boy, you really don't know Scranton, do you?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I know Scranton.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: At all!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You ever been to Scranton, Jan? Dar de-

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: If it's a couple blocks away-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dar de dar.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jan Levinson-Gould. Jan is cold. If she was sitting across from you on a train and she wasn't moving, you might think she was dead.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We should come up with a signal of some sort.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Why would we need a signal?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, in case one of us gets into trouble, the other one can signal-

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What kinda trouble are you planning on getting in, Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I... it could be either of us.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You're gonna let me do the talking, we agreed on that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeees.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello? Christian?

Quote.Speaker: Christian
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thought that was you. Hi. Michael Scott. This is Jan Levinson-Gould.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Just Jan Levinson.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No Gould?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No. [To Christian] Thank you very much for meeting with us. Have you been waiting long?

Quote.Speaker: Christian
Quote.Text: No, not long.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, Jan, what happened?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Is Gould dead? What uh-

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael, we got divorced, ok? [to Christian] I'm so sorry. Excuse me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow, you're kidding me! Do you wanna talk about?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael. [to hostess] Uh, could we have a table for three, please?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: When did this happen?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: We're in a meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Hostess
Quote.Text: This way, please.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Christian.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, after you.

Quote.Speaker: Christian
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [mouths "Wow" to the camera]

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I thought we could start by going over the needs of the county.

Quote.Speaker: Christian
Quote.Text: Right. Well, Lackawanna County has not been immune to the slow economic growth over the past five years. So for us, the name of the game is budget reduction-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Awesome blossom.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to Christian] I think we should share an Awesome Blossom, what do you say? They are awesome. Want to, Christian, blossom?

Quote.Speaker: Christian
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, it's done. Actually, [turns around] Megan, may we have an Awesome Blossom, please, extra awesome? Now it's done.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: So-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I heard a-

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: If you have a-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Very very funny joke the other day. Wanna hear it?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Christian, you don't have to listen to this.

Quote.Speaker: Christian
Quote.Text: It's ok, I like jokes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Just the one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just one joke. Ok. Well, if it's just gonna be one, I will think of a different joke. Umm... let's see... choo choo choo.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dunder-Mifflin, this is Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam, it's Michael. I need you to go into my office and check some data for me.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to Michael on speakerphone] Ok, you want me to read 'em?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ok. Um, a fisherman is walking down Fifth Avenue walking an animal behind him-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: When-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nope. Told it. Not as good as you think. Pick another one.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ok. There's a transcript between a naval ship-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh ho ho, yea! Bingo! And a lighthouse. Yes. That is hysterical. Could you start that one from the beginning?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sure. There's a transcript between a naval ship and a lighthouse.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is this real? [Pam dumps Michael's screenplay on Jim's desk]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It is a screenplay. Starring himself.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Agent Michael Scarn.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Of the FBI.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How long is this? [flips through pages] Oh, Pam. Good work! Oop, wait, stop. Drawings.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What is that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, those are drawings. In case the writing didn't really put a picture in your head. And there he is, in the flesh, Agent Michael Scarn. Now we know what he looks like.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: First guy says "Well, I'm an astronaut, so I drive a Saturn". And the second guy says, "Well, I am a pimp, so I drive a cheap Escort". And the third guy says "I gotcha both beat, I'm a proctologist, so I drive a brown Probe".

Quote.Speaker: Christian
Quote.Text: Ohhh no! [laughs] Oh my God, that's funny! I almost had Awesome Blossom coming out of my nose!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [to waitress] Excuse me, could I have a vodka tonic, please?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Do we all have our copy of "Threat Level: Midnight", by Michael Scott?

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright, let's get this started. I'm gonna be reading the action descriptions, and Phyllis, I would like you to play Catherine Zeta Jones.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: That's the character's name?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh yeah-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok, you guys should not be doing this.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why not, Dwight? This is a movie. I mean, this is for all of America to enjoy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You took something that doesn't belong to you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Brought it in here-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Do you want to play-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Made copies of it-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The lead role of Agent Michael Scarn?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [making the mouth on his tie talk] Yum! Yum yum yum! [Christian laughs] That's delicious! I love it!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: We would probably be upset with ourselves if we went this whole night without talking business, so, Dunder-Mifflin can provide a level of personal service to the county that the warehouse chains just can't match.

Quote.Speaker: Christian
Quote.Text: Well, we are out to save money.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What's the bottom line?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Bop! Be blah bop, be boo boo bop.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's why I wanted a signal, between us, so that I wouldn't have to just shout non-sense words. That's her fault.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Did somebody say "baby back ribs"? Hmmm? Hmmmmm?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I don't think Christian has time for that.

Quote.Speaker: Christian
Quote.Text: I have time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [singing] I want my baby back, baby back, baby back [Christian laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael and Christian
Quote.Text: [singing] I want my baby back, baby back, baby back-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [singing] Chili's baby back ribs...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [reading the screenplay] Inside the FBI, Agent Michael Scarn sits with his feet up on his desk. Catherine Zeta Jones enters.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Sir, you have some messages.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Not now!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: They're important.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok, what are they?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: First message is:

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, I have acted before. I was in a production of "Oklahoma" in the seventh grade. I played the part of Mutey the Mailman. They had too many kids, so they made up roles like that. I was good.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: If it isn't my old partner, Samuel L. Chang.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Agent Michael Scarn, you lost some weight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you for noticing. Now keep me company for one more mission. [Pam gets up to talk to Roy]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, uh, I have to work late.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: [looks around conference room] You're joking right?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael Scarn takes out a nine-millimeter gun and shoots the-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pow! Pow! Pow!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hahaha, Agent Michael Scarn, you so funny. Word.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Michael's movie? Two thumbs down. [Smiles] Heh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: A man sitting several seats down, who has a gold face, turns to Michael Scarn. [out of character] Uh... Ooh, Oscar, you wanna play Goldenface?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Mr. Scarn, perhaps you would be more comfortable in my private jet?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, perhaps I would, Goldenface. Sam, get my luggage.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I forget it, brutha.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Samuel, you are such an idiot, you are the worst assistant ever. And you're disgusting, Dwigt. [out of character] Wait, who's Dwigt?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Here's what we think happened. Michael's sidekick, who all through the movie is this complete idiot who's causing the downfall of the United States, was originally named Dwight. But then Michael changed it to Samuel L. Chang using a search and replace, but that doesn't work on misspelled words, leaving behind one Dwigt. And Dwight figured it out. Oops.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: D-W-I-G-H-T.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok, you know what? I am done with this. That's it, the end.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, some of us wanna keep reading, so-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, you don't speak for everyone, Jim. Ok, announcement. My uncle bought me some fireworks. Anyone who wants to see a real show, come with me outside now.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's actually a good idea. We'll all take a brief intermission. [To Pam] Hey, are you hungry?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Christian
Quote.Text: So after watching my mom go through so much pain, I decided to keep that promise, that I made to her, and take care of her.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Woo, well, this brings us to Jan. Truth or Dare? Tell us about your divorce. Ohh, ohh.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh no, Michael, Michael, please. No, really.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, so you're not gonna play? She's not playing.

Quote.Speaker: Christian
Quote.Text: It's not fair.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She's not playing the game.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: We'd been fighting for a while-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Check please.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: He didn't want kids, but I knew that going into it. But he also knew that I did. I guess I thought that he would change his mind; he thought that I would change mine.

Quote.Speaker: Christian
Quote.Text: You didn't.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I was stupid.

Quote.Speaker: Michael and Christian
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, you were not stupid. Gould was stupid. Right?

Quote.Speaker: Christian
Quote.Text: That's right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know?

Quote.Speaker: Christian
Quote.Text: You were really brave! You, you put your arms out there, you slit your wrists.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's true.

Quote.Speaker: Christian
Quote.Text: You said "World, this is my blood! It's red, just like yours. So love me!"

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I had plans to meet a friend tonight. Which I had to cancel. But this is cool, too. I'm not a complainer.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Pam lights a candle] Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: For the bugs.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nice. That's excellent, because bugs love my famous grilled cheese sandwich.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes... nice! I can't remember the last time someone made me dinner.

Quote.Speaker: Christian
Quote.Text: Right down the street?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh huh, Kenneth Road, born and raised. Spent my whole life right here in Lackawanna County and I do not intend on movin'. I know this place. I know how many hospitals we have, I know how many schools we have. It's home, you know? I know the challenges this county's up against. Here's the thing about those discount suppliers. They don't care. They come in, they undercut everything, and they run us out of business, and then, once we're all gone, they jack up the prices.

Quote.Speaker: Christian
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's bad.

Quote.Speaker: Christian
Quote.Text: It's terrible.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It, you know what, it really is.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Uh- [Michael signals for her to shh]

Quote.Speaker: Christian
Quote.Text: I don't know. I guess I could give you guys our business, but you have to meet me half way, ok, because they're expecting me to make cuts.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, corporate's gonna go ballistic, but, uh, you think we could Jan?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So, I guess I'll see you in [looks at watch] ten hours.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What are you going to do with your time off?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Travel. I've been looking forward to it. It's gonna be... really nice. Gonna find myself.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [points to Jim's iPod] You have new music?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. [Pam puts her hand out for an earbud] Definitely.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [waving to Christian] See ya.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Bye... thanks. [pumps fist] Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We did it!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: We got it!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nailed it. Nailed it! Come here.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I am really- [Michael kisses Jan] Thrilled. [Michael and Jan kiss again] Let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What!?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Goin'. Ok. Where we goin'? Doesn't matter. Goin' to the go go. [nervous laugh] Oh-ok.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [waking up on office couch] Michael? Michael? [goes into Michael's office] Michael? [looks out Michael's window] His car's not in the parking lot. I should check the accident reports. [taxi pulls into Dunder-Mifflin parking lot] Who's this? Jan?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Morning, Pam. Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, nothing happened. I-I swear, nothing happened. What, I'm, totally being serious. A gentleman does not kiss and tell, and neither do I. [laughs] No, seriously, guys, I'm not, I don't want to go into it at all. It's off limits. Fine, I took her back to her hotel and we made out for a little while. It was great. I mean she told me about her divorce, we talked for about five hours, she fell asleep on my arm. So.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Did you do her?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jan Levinson-Gould.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, no, no, no Gould.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Did you do her?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is none of your affair because she is your boss-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And she is your boss.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And she is a woman. She is a strong, soft, thoughtful, sexy woman. And you know what? I don't think that I can sit here and let you talk about her that way without me defending her honor. [to camera] Jan, I defend your honor. [to Dwight] Is that all?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Jan didn't come back for her car last night.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What!?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Could it be that Agent Michael Scarn has finally found his Catherine Zeta?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, I don't know... [Jim laughs, phone rings] Oh my God. This is Jan's cell.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No way.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dunder-Mifflin, this is Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know we have to register as a consensual sexual relationship with HR. My question:

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Some might even say that we had our first date last night.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, really?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Why might some say that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Cause there was dinner, by candlelight.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dinner and a show, if you include Michael's movie. [Pam nods reluctantly] And there was dancing and fireworks. Pretty good date.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We didn't dance.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You're right, we didn't dance. It was more like, swaying. But still romantic.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Swaying isn't dancing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Least I didn't leave you at a high school hockey game.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I have some faxes to get out.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, come on, Pam. I-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok, we didn't dance. I was totally joking anyway. I mean, it's not really a date if the girl goes home to her fiance. Right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Have you ever heard of Doctor David Friendly?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hmm...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Doctor David Friendly's Egg Yolk Diet. It's, it's kind of unique. It's just, my diet the last couple months has consisted mostly of eggs yolks and cottage cheese. And, um, what you do, you don't just have the egg yolks, it's not like a Rocky thing. You do like hard boiled eggs and I got one a those melon ballers [shot of Michael peeling boiled egg] and I, it's just like a little ice cream scoop, and I just scoop out the middle of the egg and just pop it in my mouth. I don't even, I don't even use a plate anymore. Uh, the first couple weeks I did, but you know what, boom, I keep a melon baller in my desk so if I have a hard boiled egg [Jenna breaks as Pam and laughs] I know, I know! But you know what? It's perfect. I know it sounds ridiculous, it sounds ridiculous, but you know what? Dr. David Friendly, he came up with this thing. The guy, I think he was like four hundred pounds when he started, and he started with this... I, well, the melon baller was my idea.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Most of that is good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [throwing away food from the fridge] Not today, Kevin. Cannot be around carbs today. You know what one loaf of bread would do to my abs?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I'm almost there, so we should have plenty of time to go over the presentation.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh huh.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: And, uh, hmm, excuse me, I've also confirmed the meeting this afternoon at four p.m.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Conflict!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have a conflict with that.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What do you mean?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, I have a pajama party. At the Playboy Mansion. With the bunnies.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael. I need you to take this seriously.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I can't get out of it!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, alright.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Are you hearing me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm hearing you, meeting confirmed.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: This is a very important-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Meeting confirmed. Would you like your confirmation number? Please grab a pen, because I will only be repeating this once.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [sighs] I'll see you in ten minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What is a closer? A closer is a sales term for someone who always gets the job done. And that is me. A B C, always be closing. Glen Garry, Glen Ross. "Hey, gimme the Glen Ross leads." "No way, they're just for closers." "Do you know who you're talking to?" "I'm Michael Scott." "Really? Well, take any lead you want." "No thanks, I don't need 'em." Because I have a client list [taps screen] right here in my computer. [sighs] So suck on that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't know, I think I was just staring at my desk.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really? Do you wanna get back to that? I could go. I should go.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, do you mind leaving?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, not at all.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's very important.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Do you think they'll get the account. [Stanley stares at her] How come you never answer me?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, Phyllis. No, I don't think they'll get the account.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [reading screenplay] Bullets are flying everywhere. Ooo, wait, last page, big finish. Here we go. Agent Michael Scarn kicks open the plane door with a karate chop.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: A kick and a chop are two totally different things.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, it's just a movie, Dwigt.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It doesn't make any sense.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yeah, now it doesn't make any sense.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Don't jump Agent Scarn! There are no parachutes!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Just then, Agent Chang gets a bullet in the head.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh! So close to retirement.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Another bullets heads towards Agent Michael Scarn, but he jumps out of the plane without a parachute.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Is that it?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yup, I guess so.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Does he die?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I sincerely doubt it.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I have to say, I think this is a terrible movie.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What was my worst first date? Umm. It was a couple of years ago. It was a lunch date, actually, it was right down here, at Cugino's. And we had just met, and we really hit it off, it was, it was kinda nice. Umm, huh. And, uh, then, as it turned out, it wasn't even a date, because she was actually in love with someone else. So, best first date is also my worst first date. Oddly enough.
